Roland Kayn.title: A Pan-Air Music
Roland Kayn.about: The latest unearthed gem from Kayn's home-studio archive is a meditative, textural study dated 2003, yet in some ways redolent of the work of certain experimentally inclined rock musicians of the 1970s. Across its two-hour duration, 'A Pan-Air Music' locates the ethereal space between drone and rythmic antiphony, and charts a gripping journey through it.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released December 4, 2020
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: A Pan-Air Music
trackinfo.credits: from A Pan-Air Music, released December 4, 2020

Roland Kayn.title: Abstracta
Roland Kayn.about: Abstracta’s two parts represent two highly distinct collections of sound material. The first is centred upon a series of clinking, metallic reverberations, occasionally interspersed with Kayn’s signature tonal bursts, and effected by spring-like treatments. While the opening part's tentative, exploratory feel has the focus and restraint of a free improvisation, the second finds us in very different territory. Rotating assemblies of jump-cut timbres vie with digital intrusions against a sustained backdrop of rich, expansive, near-choral tones. The stasis is gradually undermined by further tape play and occasionally interrogated by variations on the material of part one – now examined under a dramatically different lens.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released August 5, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Accumulation
Roland Kayn.about: With the jump-cut edits and staccato rhythms of its opening, ‘Accumulation’ is perhaps the closest Kayn’s unique approach came to that of his European contemporaries of the concrète school. The reverberating landscapes we glimpse throughout the piece, however, ultimately clarify our distance from this vocabulary, and the cumulative acquisition of noise-laden textures may point to a closer parallel in the most sonically fixated work of the early industrial movement.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released February 5, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2002.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Actual Basic Elements
Roland Kayn.about: This piece’s title suggests a paring down of parts – approaching a catalogue or itinerary of constituent materials. At the same time, it implies that the results of such a process will reveal the essential. In these refined materials we find a new and prominent role in Kayn's sound world for speech and human communication. But buried in the residual hiss and detritus of telephonic technology through which these ancient voices converse (and, of course, the Institute of Sonology’s studios resembled a kind of telephone exchange for the sonic aesthete), a pulsing electronic heart still beats, albeit at densely alternating frequencies and amplitudes.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released April 7, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Actual Basic Elements
trackinfo.credits: from Actual Basic Elements, released April 7, 2023

Roland Kayn.title: Agila
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Agila’ (2004) is another late tour de force for Kayn, running the gamut from nostalgic instrumental fragments to some of the most dense, violent explosions of electronic sound to be found in his entire catalogue. A weighty orchestral presence can be sensed at intervals throughout, wavering in pitch at times as if to remind us, even amid sounds of this gravity, of the plastic nature of recording itself.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released November 5, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn
Released November 5, 2021

Roland Kayn.title: An Algorithm MA 71
Roland Kayn.about: Only in Kayn’s expansive universe of cybernetic explorations could a piece like ‘An Algorithm MA 71’ seem almost a miniature. As visceral bursts of sound emerge from the fossilising medium of magnetic tape, we feel both the touch of the creator discovering the generated material, and the hand of the operator, scanning back through a lifetime of aural pathways and associations.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released December 3, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: An Algorithm MA 71
trackinfo.credits: from An Algorithm MA 71, released December 3, 2021

Roland Kayn.title: Areals
Roland Kayn.credits:
released July 5, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Athary NLX
Roland Kayn.about: Kayn’s fascination with surfing the radio waves is far from unique among 20th century musicians, but rarely do the ebb and flow of modulated/demodulated drift fit so beautifully into a composer’s modus operandi. ‘Athary NLX’ finds him spellbound by several distinct plundered excerpts; do these betray an interest and enthusiasm for contemporary sounds, or simply for the process of remixing which emerged while he was operating at a remove from the musical cultures that spawned it? Can tapping these frequencies today serve to rewrite that history?
Roland Kayn.credits:
released March 1, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Atix
Roland Kayn.about: Exploring everything from subaquatic murmur to violent electronic clangs and clashes – by way of anachronistic orchestral reminiscences – 'Atix' at first seems a more pointed study of timbral complements and contradictions than the majority of Kayn’s late work. An unusually impish perversity may be at work here in the beginning, but as rich, reverberant, drawn-out, gong-like tones begin to fill the spectral space, the listener realises that they’re adrift once more in the wide, unknown expanse of a boundless imagination.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released June 2, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Audiogenic Events
Roland Kayn.about: Like some frenetic piece of avant-garde cinema recast purely as sound, ‘Audiogenic Events’ (2004) makes its form from discrete excerpts of diverse electronic textures and shapes. Whirling the listener through a jump-cut fantasia of everything from organ and choral allusions to bubbling synthetic polyphony and violent electrical jerks and spasms, the effect both unsettles and draws one more deeply into an anti-logic all its own. No sooner than the listener locates themselves in one spatial environment, ruled by its own forms and timbres, they are spliced into the next, operating on an entirely new set of criteria. At times the piece sees Kayn unloosing some of his most vivid and unique material – tantalising glimpses of new musical worlds wholly unvisited but for these fleeting moments.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released December 1, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Break Rotations
Roland Kayn.about: From its opening moments, which resemble nothing less than a pitched-up cartoon-like parody of conversation, ‘Break Rotations’ addresses and frustrates our need for communication. Built seemingly of the sounds of transmitted data – the analog refuse of the computer modem – the piece recycles, magnifies, and interrogates our collective urge for individual expression. As the distorted segments ebb in and out of audibility, cycles of suspense gradually define themselves. In the waves of our collective subconscious, no resolution is heard.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released October 4, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Canthara
Roland Kayn.credits:
released January 3, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Configurations
Roland Kayn.credits:
released December 6, 2024
released December 6, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn
license

Roland Kayn.title: Constellations
Roland Kayn.about: Metaphors on the galactic level and beyond tend to suit Kayn’s music well. His intuitive manoeuvres between the micro and macro perspectives on sound make tantalisingly fitting analogies to everything from the births and deaths of astral bodies to the expansion and contraction of universes. With ‘Constellations’, he makes the connection explicit, as we hear the chain of events linking the composer’s private cosmos to the titanic gestures taking shape from a touch as subtle as the magician’s sleight of hand.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released June 2, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Contra-Compositie
Roland Kayn.about:
Space in music can be conceptualised in various ways, from the importance of “the unplayed notes” affirmed by the most zen-minded improvisers, to the imitation or appropriation of physical space and its acoustic qualities. Kayn’s music seems to address the notion in its many facets at various moments – at times a musical lull is preparatory to a change in acoustic setting; at others it may simply confront us with a loaded pause, cannily placed for dramatic or emotive effect.
It should be noted that we are only able to enjoy the luxurious representation, in works like ‘Contra-Compositie’, of Kayn’s masterful command of the frequency spectrum and the stereo field thanks to Jim O’Rourke’s sensitive and thorough restoration of the composers’ home recordings. This piece – spare, unhurried, yet uncompromising in its demands of the attentive listener – is perhaps among those to benefit most from this painstaking process.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released April 1, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Cyber Panoramical Music
Roland Kayn.about:
The cybernetic vision was never a modest one, its principles, commonly established for closed, self-sufficient systems, were often just as firmly intended for application on an expansive, even planetary scale. Perhaps this is why Kayn’s cybernetic creations take on a scale undreamed of except perhaps on the most grandiose 19th-century orchestral scale.
The difference here, of course, is that we have stepped outside of the metaphorical. No combination of strings, brass and percussion is required to suggest the volcanic collision of continental land masses – gargantuan slabs of noise bring it life before our very ears instead. 'Cyber Panoramical Music’ is surely one of the peaks of Kayn’s musical achievements – a cybernetic world view artistically realised.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released October 6, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Cyber Panoramical Music
trackinfo.credits: from Cyber Panoramical Music, released October 6, 2022

Roland Kayn.title: Cybernet AS & TLS
Roland Kayn.about:
Kayn's deep engagement with the field of cybernetics was perhaps the single most important differentiator in his compositional career, providing a clear conceptual break with the explorations of electronic sound taking place contemporaneously in Germany, France, and isolated pockets of activity elsewhere.
His understanding of the plurality of causal and semantic relationships within the sound itself is markedly clear in the two Cybernet pieces of 2003, where he pays explicit homage to that strain of 20th century thinking defined by Norbert Wiener as “the study of control and communication in the animal and the machine.” Once again the listener (or perhaps more appropriately, user) is situated in a unique sonic terrain, where the narrative is intuitively grasped, yet the events and their placement bear no traces of prior definition.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released September 29, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Cybernet AS
trackinfo.credits: from Cybernet AS & TLS, released September 29, 2021

trackinfo.title: Cybernet TLS
trackinfo.credits: from Cybernet AS & TLS, released September 29, 2021

Roland Kayn.title: De-Compositie
Roland Kayn.about:
From 'Contra-Compositie' (a composition of contrasts?) Kayn's oeuvre directs us to the current work, 'De-Compositie', its title suggesting an unravelling or unspooling: a disentanglement. Further evidence of the process of recall, reexamination and recontextualisation the composer applied to his sonic material.
For which other creators in any medium was such a process so richly productive? Wherever was an untempered, inward-looking resolve so fruitful and diverse in its results? The kaleidoscopic deconstruction we witness here is yet another high point in the mostly unheard expanses of Kayn's later work. With its release, another creative seam is exposed for exploration. From decomposition, fertile growth can once again take place.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 5, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Decares
Roland Kayn.about: Decares, in its title, makes clear that the feeling of vastness listeners so keenly perceive in Kayn’s music was an overarching consideration of the composer himself. From the gradual emergence of variously distant spatially arranged sound objects, to the sheer range of material and techniques we are guided through, the gigantic remains a prominent theme. Music on a tectonic scale.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released July 7, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Demodulations
Roland Kayn.about: Demodulation: the extraction of information from a carrier waveform. Here, as ever in Kayn’s late works, the past is decoded: his own. Trawling the tape archives of his years in the studio, in ‘Demodulations’ Kayn brings yet another way of addressing these extracted, convolved fragments to the fore. The listener is once again reminded that recollections are living entities, never to be set in stone.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released February 2, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Dino Concerto
Roland Kayn.about:
"Für Lydia in historischen Aufnahmen"
On an autumn afternoon in 1982, Roland Kayn improvised on the piano for his wife and muse Lydia, recording as he played. As an echo from the past, to celebrate all she meant to him and all she did for him, we release 'Dino Concerto'* on her birthday, November 13.
*Dino refers to the name Rolandino, given to him by his fellow composers during his working life in Rome.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released November 13, 2020
**Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Christiaan Richter
Producer – Ilse Kayn
**The cover artwork is made out of a selection from over 300 flowers Roland painted for his wife during his life.
© All rights reserved

Roland Kayn.title: Dispersions
Roland Kayn.credits:
released February 6, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Electronic Stabile
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Electronic Stabile’ is highly representative of Kayn’s approach to electronic composition at his home studio in the mid 2000s. Through manipulation of existing source material and the media upon which it is captured and played back, the listener is led through a wasteland of human voices, industrial sound, sustained shortwave radio noise, and modulated oscillator pitches, each imbued with the reverberation of distinctly varied physical spaces. Thus, landscapes intertwine and the work transcends mere collage. Kayn offers the listener a journey establishing new connections between transfigured materials. Meaning, intention, and origin are repeatedly interrogated along the way.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 20, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Electronic Symphony I-III
Roland Kayn.about:
In Kayn's Electronic Symphony series, the past and present continually encounter each other anew, each time casting new reflections on the given moment. Kayn's autonomous studio processes remove context from what he termed (markedly in the language of synthesis) the "carrier" material, for the most part music of the orchestral tradition at its most texturally oriented – even drone-like – but alternately seething and volcanic in its drama.
These pieces were of great personal significance to the composer, perhaps due to the fashion in which they bridged his initial musical inspirations with the new sound world his friend and colleague Franco Evangelisti described as "something that can no longer be named music".
Roland Kayn.credits:
released January 1, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, 's-Graveland.
Electronic Symphony I (1966-'96)
Electronic Symphony II (1970-'96)
Electronic Symphony III (1971-'97)
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Extensity
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Extensity’ follows the epic ‘Sound-Hydra’ in Kayn's catalogue, and continues that piece's re-exploration of the composer’s bountiful experiments at the Institute of Sonology in the 1970s and early 1980s. While the scale and source material are reminiscent of the notorious extended works of that period such as ’Infra’ and ‘Tektra’, looking back on his sound palette from the vantage point of 2001 evidently found Kayn keen to emphasise contrast over stasis. Amid the signature breathtaking sweeps and near-perpetual pitch shifts, we hear jump cuts, drop outs, and abrupt dynamic shifts settle into new, compelling features of the landscape.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released June 4, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2001.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Ghyress
Roland Kayn.about:
"Ghyress, dedicated to Kayn's daughter, is one of his most mysteriously enigmatic works, a recipe whose ingredients include nebulous drones, guitar feedback (apparently from some dissonant rock set) and touching fragments of an unknown adagio whose melancholy counterbalances the anarchic engineering of the whole structure. Outbursts of drumming and strange Star Trek choirs keep the curiosity level high as Kayn's electroacoustic sorcery shuttles us back once more into our own cryptic inadequacy."
-Massimo Ricci, Paris Transatlantic, 2005.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released March 17, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Hybriditys
Roland Kayn.about:
'Hybriditys' explores territory somewhere between the organic and the synthetic, as the fleeting, febrile grains of electrified telecommunication contrast with the languid tectonic drift of reverb-laden metallic drones and soil-like bursts of gated white noise.
In the proudest symphonic sense of the gesture, the monumental stands next to the delicate: all simply material. Expertly hewn, and ultimately laid bare for the sheer wonder of it.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released January 5, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Impactions
Roland Kayn.about: The publication of ‘Impactions’ marks 11 years since Roland Kayn passed away, and this piece numbers 100 on the composer's own list of his works. It can be seen as a model example of the electronic works he was compiling at his home studio in the mid 2000s, opening with stretches of creeping pastoral analogue beauty, before a series of cavernous reverb-laden textural episodes unfold. Finally, some form of equilibrium appears to be found as the near-percussive elements reverse and transform themselves.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released January 5, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork (special contribution) – Roos Welling
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: La Manerale
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 2, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: La Ranar
Roland Kayn.about: ‘La Ranar’ finds us in some hinterland between the celestial and the industrial; grandeur and detritus. Is there even a distinction to be made between the two? Aren’t stars also born of the waste matter of the universe? Here Kayn plunders his own archive yet again to discover an infinity in the still-twitching relics of discovery itself.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released December 1, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Les Characées
Roland Kayn.credits:
released September 6, 2024
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Made in the NL after the Sixties and Beyond
Roland Kayn.about:
'Made in the NL After the Sixties and Beyond' finds Kayn examining his early groundbreaking work from the vantage point of his later years. New sounds remembered, their indefinable power undiminished.
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2008.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released September 4, 2020
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke

Roland Kayn.title: Matego I-II
Roland Kayn.about:
The master tape of Roland Kayn's final composition was still present in the machine when he passed away on January 5th, 2011. 'Matego', the last piece in a 60-year puzzle, is a tense structure of modulated crystalline bursts. Far from conclusive in tone, it suggests that Kayn could well have continued fruitfully on his path of exploration and discovery for decades longer.
To mark the 10th anniversary of Kayn's passing, and to celebrate the enthusiastic response to the new availability of his work, we are proud to offer this music as a free download, with the option of a donation to the Lydia and Roland Kayn Archive.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released January 5, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2010.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Music for the Isle of Man
Roland Kayn.about:
During World War II the Isle of Man was used as the primary site for the internment of "civilian enemy aliens", both male and female.
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released August 6, 2020
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Music for the Isle of Man
trackinfo.credits: from Music for the Isle of Man, released August 6, 2020

Roland Kayn.title: Mutenaces
Roland Kayn.about:
Can electroacoustic music – born of the glitch, the treatment, and the edit – be beautiful? The sheer beauty of the sounds employed in Kayn’s music is too little remarked upon, their luxuriant, occasionally repeated deployment perhaps hinting at how the composer himself might answer that question.
No other body of work continually returns us to the tipping point between futurism and mysterious quasi-nostalgia – disorientation and inexplicable familiarity. The effect is fascinating, and Mutenaces embodies it bountifully.
No sooner than the listener begins to wonder at how a sound could be conceived, but it begins to move. We realise once again that we are not standing entranced before a static image, but an assemblage of pieces in continual motion. An alien architecture unfolding.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released September 2, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: November Music
Roland Kayn.about: Drawing lines between the lunar cartography of the Sonology-era tapes and the playful, plunderphonic impulses of his late work, November Music is perfect, capsule-sized Kayn. The piece forms a convenient introduction for any new listener, while offering the connoisseur a series of tantalising glimpses into his prismatic bank of materials.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released November 6, 2020
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Oktrol
Roland Kayn.about: “Repetition is a form of change.” quoth the oblique strategy. But then where do we locate stasis? With Oktrol, a sub-rosa enquiry into the nature of the plateau, Kayn finds one answer. Turning his material in the light, filtering, reversing and exposing it again and again, he reaches a range of new possibilities. From the oceanic to the stratosphere, similitude is revealed to be both illusory and quietly all-encompassing.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 5, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Osmotic Sounds
Roland Kayn.credits:
released June 6, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

from Osmotic Sounds, released June 6, 2025

Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin

Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Othyrsis
Roland Kayn.credits:
released April 3, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Otron
Roland Kayn.about:
Otron, as a title, has the typical Kaynian classical and scientific redolences, yet refers to no specific mythical protagonist or experimental technique. The English surname “Orton" descends from the old English for “shore settlement”. Is Kayn claiming new territory here? Striking land? The more dramatically inclined will almost certainly prick up their ears here.
In the 1980s, photographer Michael Orton would blend two distinct images of the same scene to reveal otherwise impossible details simultaneously. Perhaps this Orton effect proves a better key to Kayn’s piece, as focal point pursues focal point over the work’s duration, the horizon continually shifting. Another potential entrance to the composer's chamber of diffuse secrets.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released January 6, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Random Distributions
Roland Kayn.about: Did procedures reliant on probabilistic calculations play a role in Kayn’s later work? The title ‘Random Distributions’ may suggest as much, but the listener shouldn’t forget the role of intuition in this work. (The composer spent key formative years in an improvising ensemble, after all.) The reference is perhaps a more allusive one, pointing to the ever-increasing common ground between mathematics and nature, where discovery and creative self-discovery intertwine.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 3, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Rathan
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Rathan’ as a piece lives very much in the springs of Kayn’s reverberation units and in the electron fog of multiple generations of tape edits. Counterintuitively, somehow the resultant musical haze brings about a sharpening of the listener’s senses – as sound is disembodied from source, the brain resists, struggling to bridge the gap and identify the unidentifiable. We ultimately perceive only the winding, slowing and recoiling of acoustic phenomena, as if hearing some Proustian resequencing and reexamination of a life witnessed by the ears alone.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released March 2, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Reflets du Spectral
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Reflets du Spectral’ immediately follows ‘Spectral’ in Kayn’s catalogue, suggesting the composer found further untapped potential in the latter’s material or approach. Opening with the taut crystalline shards of sound so often deployed in his later work, ‘Reflets’ later finds resolution in a kind of electronically induced orchestral tremolo, before a coda almost choral in its synthetic timbre finishes this chapter conclusively.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 7, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Reflets du Spectral
trackinfo.credits: from Reflets du Spectral, released May 7, 2021

Roland Kayn.title: Remake A
Roland Kayn.about: The first in a pair of twin works from 2002, ‘Remake A’ gives the listener more time to decode abstract views only glimpsed momentarily elsewhere. Sustained glassy feedback tones are layered sparsely and patiently, gradually forming a shifting prismatic electroacoustic mobile. As is so often the case in Kayn’s music, the landscape may be familiar, but the journey is unique.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released July 1, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2002.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Remake B
Roland Kayn.about: The second in a pair of twin works from 2002, ‘Remake B’ gives the listener further opportunity to decode abstract views glimpsed only momentarily elsewhere. Here, elegiac blocks of echo-laden sound are deployed like land masses, giving a sense of oceanic, if not galactic vastness. As is so often the case in Kayn’s music, the landscape may be familiar, but the journey is unique.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released August 4, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2002.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Requiem pour Patrice Lumumba
Roland Kayn.about:
The first track of the 4 track album MULTIPLEX SOUND-ART - CD 004, "Requiem pour Patrice Lumumba".
Patrice Émery Lumumba was the first Prime Minister of the independent Democratic Republic of the Congo (then Republic of the Congo), but was murdered by his opponents, with the complicity of the Belgian government, the United States and the UN.
Kayn first heard of these events from his friend, conductor Andrzej Markowski. He had never before written a requiem, and elected to make Lumumba his subject.
'Requiem pour Patrice Lumumba' was previously released on the ‘Multiplex Sound-Art’ CD in 2004 (Reiger-records-reeks, KY-CD 004-1/2). The recording has now been remastered and rereleased upon the occasion of Bandcamp’s Juneteenth stand for racial justice and equality.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released June 19, 2020
Cover artwork – “Afrikanischer Traum” (“African Dream”) by Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Requiem pour Patrice Lumumba
trackinfo.credits: from Requiem pour Patrice Lumumba, released June 19, 2020

Roland Kayn.title: Residual Sounds
Roland Kayn.about:
‘Residual Sounds’ suggests the remainder, the cast-offs – the unusable scraps. But as orchestral tones slither into audibility, we think more of the dream life here: the residue of the psyche.
Instrumental timbres shift into reverberation-laden voices, uttering unintelligible messages. The sound, for its muddle of meaning, is clear, spacious. A classic Kayn manoeuvre: in the rejected clusters of material, his most lush, melodic material emerges from the fog.
Residue is no disparagement here. In the churns of the sonic drift, these residual whispers constitute yet another hitherto-unglimpsed musical constellation.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released November 3, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Reversioni Comprimati
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Reversioni Comprimati’ could be subtitled ‘Anatomy of a Tape Recorder’, defined as it is by the dynamic, throbbing motion of Kayn’s workhorse machines' spinning reels. But this is no repetitive work of loops and cells. Instead, a heavily effected mid-range narrative carries the listener through percussive, pseudo-instrumental passages, the circular washes – now percussive, now strings, now elongated bell tones – morphing and jaggedly shapeshifting their way along a clearly delineated line. In rare, isolated moments of recognition, a familiar snippet of another work might dart into view. But here, such fragments serve another process, a distinct intention.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released July 1, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Sezarytes
Roland Kayn.credits:
released March 7, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: Sezarytes
trackinfo.credits:
from Sezarytes, released March 7, 2025
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Sonority ERT
Roland Kayn.about: Many composers have attempted to compose a music that reveals itself primarily in texture, from the impressionism of Debussy to the way Schoenberg’s klangfarbenmelodie later informed the systematisation of timbre in the work of Stockhausen and others. There are few counterparts, however, to Kayn’s approach to this problem, brought to a level of near-obsessive abandon in works such as ‘Sonority ERT’. From the clangorous depths of an atonal industrial assault to the dreamy sun-dazed blur of its closing minutes, here we hear texture as readily malleable musical resource – a sonic meditation.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released November 3, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Sorales I
Roland Kayn.about: The tidal swells of ‘Sorales I’ initially place us within an audio-geological parallel which must be becoming familiar to Kayn's listeners by now. But as filtered detritus swings in and out of range like driftwood – given structure by gongs, sweeping fissural bursts of white noise, and the unmistakable tones of plucked metal strings – it becomes apparent that this non-existent post-industrial beach is in fact the orchestral palette inverted, and the very idea of instrumental arrangement is twisted back upon itself in a shocking yet compelling manner.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released August 4, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Sorales II
Roland Kayn.about:
As the oceanic swell of ‘Sorales’ continues into its second part, it’s hard not to marvel at Kayn’s restraint: a Cagean found-object appreciation of his own working materials is perhaps evident, as he allows them to breathe and envelope the listener.
As ever, we are beguiled by sound without readily apparent origin. Is that slowly barreling feedback or the tide-like movement of an infinitely stretched orchestral passage? Lost in the waves, we can only submit to the unremitting flow of sound.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released September 1, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Sound-Hydra
Roland Kayn.about: A prismatic assembly with as many faces as the mythological beast which gives the piece its title, Sound-Hydra represents an endlessly regenerative encounter. An extended plunderphonic odyssey from a moment at which Kayn was acutely in touch with the music beginning to sprout up around his prior discoveries and innovations.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released October 2, 2020
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2001.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn
© All rights reserved

Roland Kayn.title: Spectral
Roland Kayn.about: The cloudy, sustained tones of ‘Spectral’ find Kayn in territory almost as weightless as that of ‘A Pan-Air Music’. In its opening minutes, dense flute-like timbres amass in an echoing plane of sound reminiscent at times of Luc Ferrari’s most disembodied audio surrealism. But this is no derivative (nor pastiche), as Kayn’s time spent amid the Staaplaat racks is soon also in evidence. As the work progresses, we find him locating, digesting – and perhaps even repurposing – the spiritual heirs of his earlier, uniquely groundbreaking work.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released April 2, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Superficies
Roland Kayn.about: ‘Superficies’ is a deeply immersive study in perpetual motion. From a rich base of Shepard-like tones, suggesting an auditory illusion in which throbbing atmospheres appear to be continuously rising, we find ourselves in the imaginary score of a journey impossible to capture on celluloid. Elements clash and are abruptly silenced. Overtones build, until we finally apprehend that these multiplexed machine voices are nothing less than a choir.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released October 6, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Textures
Roland Kayn.credits:
released August 2, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: The Art of Sound
Roland Kayn.about: As strong as Kayn’s passion for the often tempestuous, pseudo-algorithmic selections of his machines, was his evident fondness for a sound world redolent of unfolding pastoral beauty. Perhaps this is the dividing line, after all, between composer and sound artist. ‘The Art of Sound’ highlights this ambiguity in more than its title alone, for however alien the sound sources, its effect – like Beethoven’s 6th – is “more the expression of feeling than painting”.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released February 4, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: The Man and the Biosphere
Roland Kayn.about:
Following his retirement in 1998, composer and founding figure of cybernetic music Roland Kayn (1933-2011) did not relax the pace of his output. On the contrary, his oeuvre grew exponentially, and some of his most expansive works were to take shape at his home studio in Nieuwe Pekela in the Dutch province of Groningen.  Through the late 1990s and early 2000s, several of these compositions were released on CD on the composer’s own label, Reiger-records-reeks, which was revived in 2019 by his daughter Ilse for the momentous release of ‘Scanning’ (1982-83).
However, the Lydia-und Roland-Kayn-Archiv holds dozens of these works, many of them as ambitious in scope as classics such as ‘Tektra’ and ‘Infra’, which have earned Kayn a loyal following among the current generation of electronic music enthusiasts.
In 2003 alone, Kayn produced 15 pieces. One of these – the hitherto-unheard ‘The Man and the Biosphere’ – now forms the first release for an exciting new Bandcamp page dedicated to works from the archive.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released May 23, 2020
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn
Reiger-records-reeks KY-DL 2001
© ℗ Reiger-records-reeks 2020

trackinfo.title: The Man and the Biosphere
trackinfo.credits: from The Man and the Biosphere, released May 23, 2020

Roland Kayn.title: TLS
Roland Kayn.about: 'TLS' is a veritable magician’s cauldron of swirling gaseous textures and liquid transitions. Whether or not Kayn’s title refers to the cryptographic networking protocol of the same name, the theme of distorted communications redeeming their meaning at a set focal point in time and space seems – as the mists finally clear – wholly appropriate.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released April 5, 2024
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2005.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: TLX
Roland Kayn.about:
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2006
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.title: TLX
trackinfo.about:

Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Transit
Roland Kayn.about: Opening with Lynchian reverse swells and chirping grains of sound, ‘Transit’ soon begins a slowly ebbing journey inward. Redolent of the best early post-industrial work (yet without co-opting such material directly, on this occasion at least), this alien broadcast rewards repeated exploration.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released August 31, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2003.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Triades
Roland Kayn.about:
Kayn’s electronic works are often characterized by their density, as his cybernetic practices allow material to build from tones to clusters, and finally into his trademark primordial swathes of electronic sound.
‘Triades’, by contrast, is a model of clarity. Drones exist only in crystalline isolation. Plundered sources are inserted nakedly into the mix, undisguised and often unadorned. Effects are used more sparingly, often only to bring certain sounds to the fore momentarily. Startling concrete stabs and shards of found sound are turned in the light, shaping the escalating tension into a near-meditative study in timbre.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released March 4, 2022
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Xutus
Roland Kayn.about: The latest première from the Kayn archives opens with the composer already several layers deep into the endless process of use-process-reuse that characterises so much of his work. Textural washes are stretched until taut into almost choral tones. Tape warble gives way to arrays of submerged granular shapes. Kayn's limitless fascination with the mutability of sound itself once again approaches its apotheosis.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released March 5, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2002.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Yellowings Conglomerations
Roland Kayn.about: When plundered fragments of concrete sound meet the cathedral-like slowed tape drone in the opening moments of ‘Yellowings Conglomerations’, it’s tempting to see the piece as a deliberate exploration of memory, aging, and the inescapable accumulation of personal histories. The music is in no rush to confirm or dismiss this view, leading the listener through a gallery of disembodied fragments, rendered ambiguous through techniques like exaggerated edits or time-bending stretch. As these enigmatic clusters dissolve into the timeline, memory becomes something to be reached for, enveloped within, perhaps even mocked.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released February 3, 2023
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

Roland Kayn.title: Zone Senza Silenzio
Roland Kayn.about:
In Kayn's “Areas Without Silence”, we find a degree of tonal clarity and dextrous timbral manipulation that marks the piece as a standout work of the period. From the refracting, spacious tones of the opening section, the listener is guided through a hall of mirrors where the line between material and process will soon become invisible.
This previously unreleased and newly mastered recording has been published upon the occasion of Bandcamp’s Juneteenth stand for racial justice and equality.
Roland Kayn.credits:
released June 18, 2021
Realisation: Reiger Recording Studio, Nieuwe Pekela, 2004.
Cover artwork – Bill Maerklin
Mastering – Jim O'Rourke
Producer – Ilse Kayn

trackinfo.credits: from Zone Senza Silenzio, released June 18, 2021
